Package game.modes

Class ManualMode

java.lang.Object
game.modes.Simulation
game.modes.ManualMode
All Implemented Interfaces:
SimulationI
public class ManualMode
extends Simulation
The ManualMode class provides a simulation mode where players can manually interact with the game environment and make decisions, such as selecting routes, using items, or staying at the current position. It extends the Simulation class and incorporates custom logic for user-driven gameplay.

The ManualMode gameplay is characterized by: - Manual decision-making for the player's movements. - Interactions with items and enemies within the game environment. - Displaying detailed intel about the game environment (enemies, items, paths, etc.) to the player.

  • Constructor Details

    • ManualMode

      public ManualMode​(Mission missionImpl, Player player, Report report)
      Constructs a ManualMode instance using the specified mission, player, and report. This class is responsible for managing the manual gameplay mode and its associated operations.
      Parameters:
      missionImpl - the mission implementation that defines the game's scenario and objectives
      player - the player participating in the manual gameplay mode
      report - the report instance used to log and display game-related information

  • Method Details

    • game

      public void game() throws ElementNotFoundException, EmptyCollectionException
      Executes the primary game flow for the manual mode. This method performs a series of steps to initiate and manage the simulation, including rendering manual simulation, displaying critical game intel, managing room entries, and setting the player's starting position. Finally, it triggers the overarching game flow logic.
      Specified by:
      game in interface SimulationI
      Specified by:
      game in class Simulation
      Throws:
      ElementNotFoundException - if a required element is not found during the execution.
      EmptyCollectionException - if an operation is attempted on an empty collection.

    • movePlayer

      public void movePlayer() throws ElementNotFoundException
      Moves the player to the next position or stays in the current position based on the game state and the player's decision. This method manages the overall game progression during the player's turn. If the mission is not accomplished, the method: - Displays relevant game information using the sophisticated spy system. - Calculates and displays the possible path to the player's next objective. - Allows the player to select their next position from available options, including staying in the current room. - Updates the player's position and the turn order based on the player's choice. - Adds the new room to the game report for tracking movement history. - Renders additional intel using the sophisticated spy system interface. If the mission is accomplished, the game is marked as over.
      Specified by:
      movePlayer in interface SimulationI
      Specified by:
      movePlayer in class Simulation
      Throws:
      ElementNotFoundException - if any required game element, such as a room or objective, is missing.
